page.title: 10THE KNIGHTLEY WAY
page.content: The Knightley Way is a public footpath which goes from Greens Norton to Badby The path starts in Greens Norton off Blakesley Hill and is an exact diagonal of our block.The Way is well marked and thanks to the co-operation of the two farmers over whose land it passes is easily negotiable.The only diversion is around the Caswell Research Centre where there is an opportunity to view a well constructed lake complete with wild life.Most of the route is over arable land with a wire fence on each side,but on approaching Foxley care has to be taken to remain on the route as one marker sign is over the horizon.The Knightley Way is a continuation of The Grafton Way which enters Greens Norton from the south-east.
